snippet: Edward J. Snowden said that he initially told officials of his concerns about the National Security Agency’s surveillance operations, but that none “took any action.”
abstract: Former National Security Agency contractor Edward J Snowden says he raised concerns to more than 10 United States officials, none of whom took action, before he decided to give trove of classified documents to journalists; statement is among newly-released written answers that Snowden provided to members of the European Parliament.
lead_paragraph: Edward J. Snowden said that he initially told officials of his concerns about the National Security Agency’s surveillance operations, but that none “took any action.”

headline.main: Snowden Says He Reported N.S.A. Surveillance Concerns Before Leaks
headline.print_headline: Snowden Says He Reported Concerns Before Leaks

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
